title: Princess Diana's biggest fashion mishaps
text: comments She's regarded as one of the biggest fashion icons of all time but even Princess Diana was the victim of a fair few fashion fails. The late Princess, whose dazzling wardrobe is the focus of a major new exhibition tracing the evolution of the Princessâ€™s style, 20 years after her death, certainly didn't always get it right. Diana, who made the transition from demure dresser to sartorial style queen, often plumped for garish gowns and unflattering frocks. Here we reveal her biggest sartorial mishaps. As an exhibition opens celebrating Princess Diana's fashion hits, we reveal her biggest sartorial mishaps, which often included garish red carpet gowns Tartan was a favourite motif of the princess' in the late '80s and early '90s, like the red and green Catherine Walker coat dress she chose for a trip to Japan (left) and a blue tartan Emanuel suit during an official visit to Venice, Italy, with the Prince of Wales (right) When she joined Prince Charles on the red carpet during her 'Shy Di' years, the late Princess would often drown her petite frame in frumpy dresses Diana, who had a penchant for tartan, would often overkill the pattern. Pictured: Princess Diana in Berlin in 1987 wearing a canary yellow coat by Escada and Philip Somerville hat Diana chose a voluminous black skirt with a shiny orange blazer and a bow tie for an outing in Lisbon (left), and a boxy Moschino suit (right) as she left London for a state visit to Italy in 1990 The proportions of this Azagury dress were unflattering even on the famously willowy Diana Diana was in danger of being mistaken for a waitress in her Jasper Conran suit in Florence in 1985 (left), and the jumper she wore for a pre-wedding shoot bordered on novelty territory Fashion wise, nobody escaped the '80s unscathed, not even the ever glamorous princess A colourful striped skirt and a coordinating velvet blazer were Diana's ensemble of choice for a rock concert in London's West End in 1991 Matchy matchy is not the word: Diana at the Braemar Games in a tartan suit by one of her favourite designers, Catherine Walker Princess Diana's military style suit by Catherine Walker and hat by Graham Smith at Kangol was among her less successful looks Share or comment on this article Most watched News videos
